qas.question: What arts does Liberia have a rich history of?
In what years did Liberia host national fairs?
Who did Martha Ann Ricks present the famed Liberian coffee tree to?
What did President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf have installed in her presidential office?
In what years did Liberia host coffee festivals?
Who did Martha Ann Ricks present the quilting skills to?
What arts were brought to Liberia by Queen Victoria?
What kind of tree did Ellen Johnson Sirleaf own?
Where did Queen Victoria install her quilt?

context: Liberia has a long, rich history in <a0_0><b7_0>textile arts and quilting<b7_0/><a0_0/>, as the settlers brought with them their sewing and quilting skills. Liberia hosted National Fairs in <a1_0><b5_0>1857 and 1858<b5_0/><a1_0/> in which prizes were awarded for various needle arts. One of <a2_0>the most well-known Liberian quilters<a2_0/> was Martha Ann Ricks, who presented a quilt featuring the famed <b8_0>Liberian coffee tree<b8_0/> to <a3_0><b6_0>Queen Victoria<b6_0/><a3_0/> in 1892. When President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf moved into the Executive Mansion, she reportedly had a <a4_0>Liberian-made quilt<a4_0/> installed in <b9_0>her presidential office<b9_0/>.
